definition: to be fair/to be impartial/to settle (a matter etc)
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: OK, where is the streaking Minstrel?We've got to put an end to this.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，那个裸奔的吟游诗人在哪？我们得把这事摆平。

sentences.english: Shirley stars got a call from the mayor, let him handle Qingdao demonstration event.
sentences.chinese: 厉辰星接到市长的电话，让他摆平青岛示威事件。

sentences.english: So this is the girl that roughed up Vega?
sentences.chinese: 这就是那个摆平维嘉的女孩？

sentences.english: If I don't floor him now, Ishall murder him sometime;
sentences.chinese: 如果我现在不摆平他，总有一天我会杀掉他。

sentences.english: Yu Xianyang turned and waved fists will be agile, a Japanese doctor.
sentences.chinese: 俞显扬身手敏捷，转身挥动拳脚将日本医生摆平。

definition: to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
to clear up the mess/to pick up the pieces
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
to accomplish/to get sth done
to persuade
to deal with the aftermath (arising from an accident)/funeral arrangements/reparations
to run off rebuffed/to fend off/(to fight off and make sb) run off
to dominate/to control/to subdue/to crush
to get rid of
to kill/to put to death
to subdue/to force to capitulate/to reduce to submission/to soothe
to intercede/to plead for sb else
to purchase/to bribe
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to handle/to deal with/to cope/to get by with
prevail/convince
